archdesc.runner: Digital Libraries and Archives, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Digital Libraries and Archives, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
did.unittitle:
Virginia Hummel Papers
1830-1998
did.origination: The Virginia Hummel collection was donated in April 1998 by Hummel's daughters, Mary Benton Hummel and Elizabeth Hancock. The collection was organized by Sarah Gouger, student assistant, and Laura Katz Smith, Manuscript Curator.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Virginia Hummel Papers must be obtained from the Digital Library and Archives, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Hummel, Virginia Papers, 1830-1998, Ms98-014, Digital Libraries and Archives, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Hummel, born on September 28, 1916, was an English teacher with Blacksburg High School and an avid amateur historian of Blacksburg and Appalachian regional history. Much of the subject matter of the materials concerns the history of Blacksburg and Montgomery County, Virginia. Hummel died on May 19, 1998, at the age of 81.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The Virginia Hummel collection consists of newspaper clippings, research notes, photographs, maps, and blueprints collected and created by Virginia Hummel of Blacksburg.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged according to date.
